MainHeading.P: Cromadh ar obair an lae ar 12.15 p.m.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. EAMON DUGGAN Mr. EAMON DUGGAN
Speaker.P: (Minister without Portfolio), entered and announced that he had been authorised by the Governor-General to administer the Oath to the Members of Seanad Eireann.

Speaker.hpid: The CLERK The CLERK
Speaker.P: read the following communication:—
“Vice Regal Lodge, Dublin.
“To EAMON DUGGAN, Esq., T.D.

“I hereby authorise and empower you to administer to each Member of Seanad Eireann the Oath prescribed by Article 17 of the Constitution of the Irish Free State, and to present the same to each Member for subscription.
“Given at Dublin, this 11th day of
December, 1922.
“T.M. HEALY,
“Governor-General.”
SEANADÓIRÍ DO CHUR FÉ MHÓID NO FÉ DHEARBHÚ.
(Swearing or Affirming of Senators).
The Senators took and subscribed the Oath in the following order:—
Sir Thomas Henry Grattan Esmonde.
Edmund W. Eyre.
Martin Fitzgerald.
Dowager Countess of Desart.

MainHeading.P: Eibhlín Bean Mhic Choisdealbha (Mrs. E. Costelloe).

Speaker.hpid: Sir THOMAS HENRY GRATTAN ESMONDE Sir THOMAS HENRY GRATTAN ESMONDE
Speaker.P: It would seem that every Senator has taken the Oath, and to put ourselves in order, as a temporary measure we should appoint a Chairman until we can decide among ourselves who is to be our permanent presiding officer. Therefore, I beg to move, as a tribute to our oldest member, that Dr. George Sigerson be appointed Chairman for this day only, until the Seanad shall decide who shall be its permanent Chairman. The appointment can be made on the understanding that we can come together to-morrow, at an hour which is found generally convenient, to appoint our permanent Chairman. That being so, I have the honour to move that Dr. Sigerson take the Chair for this day.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. ALICE STOPFORD GREEN Mrs. ALICE STOPFORD GREEN
Speaker.P: I am glad to second that proposal. We have only had notice handed to us as we came in of the business to-day, and we need a little time for consultation. It would be to us an honour if so learned and faithful an historian of Ireland would take the Chair for this day.

Speaker.hpid: Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE
Speaker.P: I take it the Seanad will agree to this Resolution?
Question put: “That Dr. George Sigerson be elected Chairman of the Seanad for to-day.”
Agreed.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. GEORGE SIGERSON Dr. GEORGE SIGERSON
Speaker.P: took the Chair.

Speaker.hpid: CHAIRMAN CHAIRMAN
Speaker.P: It is now our duty to consider the appointment of a Committee for drawing up the Standing Orders of this Seanad.

Speaker.hpid: Colonel MAURICE MOORE Colonel MAURICE MOORE
Speaker.P: I propose that a Committee to enquire into the Standing Orders for the Seanad should be appointed. I have made some enquiries and I find that Standing Orders have already been adopted for Dáil Eireann, and I think that it would be a good plan, as we must have some Standing Orders to carry us on, if we could accept for the moment the Standing Orders of Dáil Eireann so far as they may be applicable to the Seanad, until such time as the Committee which we could appoint now considers the matter and draws up suitable Standing Orders. I will not make any suggestion as to the names of the Committee for the moment until the motion has been seconded and somebody else makes suggestions.

Speaker.hpid: Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE
Speaker.P: I have pleasure in seconding the proposition.
Question put: “That a Committee be appointed to draw up Standing Orders for Seanad Eireann.”
Agreed.

Speaker.hpid: CHAIRMAN CHAIRMAN
Speaker.P: There is a suggestion that the Seanad should meanwhile adopt the Standing Orders which have been adopted by Dáil Eireann.

Speaker.hpid: CHAIRMAN CHAIRMAN
Speaker.P: The next question is the appointment of members on a Committee to prepare Standing Orders.

Speaker.hpid: Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE
Speaker.P: I would move that Lord Glenavy, Sir John Keane, Mr. Douglas, Mr. Kenny, Mr. Moran, Mr. Goodbody, Lord Granard, and Lord Dunraven be members of this Committee on Standing Orders. This Committee would, of course, have power to add to its numbers.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. McPARTLIN Mr. McPARTLIN
Speaker.P: I beg to move the addition of the name of Mr. John T. O'Farrell.

Speaker.hpid: Sir NUGENT EVERARD Sir NUGENT EVERARD
Speaker.P: It would be wise to put on two names instead of those of Lord Dunraven and Lord Granard. Lord Dunraven is not well, and Lord Granard has to go to America.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. COSTELLOE Mrs. COSTELLOE
Speaker.P: I beg to propose the name of Mrs. Wyse Power.

Speaker.hpid: Sir NUGENT EVERARD Sir NUGENT EVERARD
Speaker.P: I suggest the addition of the name of Sir T. Esmonde to the Committee.

Speaker.hpid: Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE Sir T.H. GRATTAN ESMONDE
Speaker.P: I am in the hands of the Seanad. It is now proposed that the Committee consist of Lord Glenavy, Sir J. Keane, Mr. Douglas, Mr. Moran, Mr. Kenny, Mr. Goodbody, Mr. O'Farrell, Mrs. Wyse-Power, and Sir T. Esmonde.

Speaker.hpid: Sir NUGENT EVERARD Sir NUGENT EVERARD
Speaker.P: I second the proposition.

Question put: “That a Committee on Standing Orders consisting of the following be appointed:—Lord Glenavy, Sir J. Keane, Mr. Douglas, Mr. Moran, Mr. Kenny, Mr. Goodbody, Mr. O'Farrell, Mrs. Wyse-Power, and Sir Thomas Esmonde.”
Agreed.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. DOUGLAS Mr. DOUGLAS
Speaker.P: I beg to move the adjournment of the Seanad until 3 o'clock to-morrow afternoon. I understand that the Governor-General is to make a speech to-morrow afternoon at 3 o'clock, and that Dáil Eireann will be meeting and that it is desirable the Seanad should sit here at the same time. I, therefore, propose that we adjourn until 3 o'clock to-morrow. I understand the other room will be available after the speech for the further sitting of the Seanad.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. T.W. BENNETT Mr. T.W. BENNETT
Speaker.P: I second the proposition.
Question put: “That the Seanad adjourn until 3 o'clock on Tuesday, 12th December.”
Agreed.
The Seanad adjourned at 1.10 p.m.
